    • Method Detail

      • startWebServer

        public static org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server startWebServer()
        Creates and starts an embedded web server on a JVM-assigned HTTP ports. Each response has a body that indicates how many bytes were received with a message like "Received x bytes\n".
        Returns:
        Instance of Server

      • startWebServerWithResponse

        public static org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server startWebServerWithResponse(byte[] content)
        Creates and starts an embedded web server on a JVM-assigned HTTP ports. Creates and starts embedded web server that is running on given port. Each response has a body that contains the specified contents.
        Returns:
        Instance of Server

      • startWebServer

        public static org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server startWebServer(boolean enableHttps)
        Creates and starts an embedded web server on JVM-assigned HTTP and HTTPS ports. Each response has a body that indicates how many bytes were received with a message like "Received x bytes\n".
        Parameters:
        enableHttps - if true, an HTTPS connector will be added to the web server
        Returns:
        Instance of Server

      • startWebServerWithResponse

        public static org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server startWebServerWithResponse(boolean enableHttps,
                                                                         byte[] content)
        Creates and starts an embedded web server on JVM-assigned HTTP and HTTPS ports. Each response has a body that contains the specified contents.
        Parameters:
        enableHttps - if true, an HTTPS connector will be added to the web server
        content - The response the server will return
        Returns:
        Instance of Server

      • findLocalHttpPort

        public static int findLocalHttpPort(org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server webServer)
        Finds the port the specified server is listening for HTTP connections on.
        Parameters:
        webServer - started web server
        Returns:
        HTTP port, or -1 if no HTTP port was found

      • findLocalHttpsPort

        public static int findLocalHttpsPort(org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server webServer)
        Finds the port the specified server is listening for HTTPS connections on.
        Parameters:
        webServer - started web server
        Returns:
        HTTP port, or -1 if no HTTPS port was found

      • createProxiedHttpClient

        public static org.apache.http.client.HttpClient createProxiedHttpClient(int port)
                                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates instance HttpClient that is configured to use proxy server. The proxy server should run on 127.0.0.1 and given port
        Parameters:
        port - the proxy port
        Returns:
        instance of HttpClient
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createProxiedHttpClient

        public static org.apache.http.client.HttpClient createProxiedHttpClient(int port,
                                                                        boolean supportSSL)
                                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates instance HttpClient that is configured to use proxy server. The proxy server should run on 127.0.0.1 and given port
        Parameters:
        port - the proxy port
        supportSSL - if true, client will support SSL connections to servers using self-signed certificates
        Returns:
        instance of HttpClient
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isUnixManagementCapable

        public static boolean isUnixManagementCapable()
        Determines if we are running on a Unix-like operating system that exposes a UnixOperatingSystemMXBean.
        Returns:
        true if this is a Unix OS and the JVM exposes a UnixOperatingSystemMXBean, otherwise false.
